questions.item1: The average (arithmetic mean) of five numbers is 12. If four of the numbers are 9, 15, 10, and 14, what is the value of the fifth number?
questions.item2: The average (arithmetic mean) of a set of 10 numbers is 25. If the sum of 9 of the numbers is 225, what is the value of the 10th number?
questions.item3: A store sells a shirt for $25. If the store increases the price by 20%, what will the new price of the shirt be?
questions.item4: In a group of 30 students, the average age is 16. If the average age of the 10 male students is 17 and the average age of the 20 female students is 15, what is the combined age of all the students?
questions.item5: A basketball team played 25 games. In the first 10 games, they won 6 games; in the next 10 games, they won 7 games; and in the last 5 games, they won 4 games. What is the team's overall win percentage?
questions.item6: A car rental company charges $25 per day for renting a car and $0.15 per mile driven. If a person rents a car for 5 days and drives 120 miles, how much does the person owe?
questions.item7: A box contains 12 red, 8 blue, and 10 green marbles. If one marble is selected at random, what is the probability that it is either red or green?
questions.item8: A student takes 4 tests and scores 90, 85, 88, and 92. What is the minimum score the student needs on the fifth test to have an average score of 90?
questions.item9: The price of a book is $12. The store applies a 10% discount. After the discount is applied, a sales tax of 8% is added to the new price. What is the final price of the book?
questions.item10: A factory produces 1000 units of a product each day. If the production rate decreases by 5% each day, what will be the total number of units produced after 10 days?
questions.item11: The mean of 8 numbers is 16. If the sum of the first 6 numbers is 90, what is the sum of the last 2 numbers?
questions.item12: A survey shows that 60% of people prefer coffee over tea. If 200 people are surveyed, how many people prefer coffee?
questions.item13: A store offers a 25% discount on all items. If the original price of an item is $120, what is the sale price of the item after the discount?
questions.item14: In a class of 30 students, 15 students are taking a math test, 18 students are taking a science test, and 10 students are taking both tests. How many students are taking neither test?
questions.item15: A machine produces 500 units of product per hour. If the machine operates for 8 hours a day, how many units will it produce in 10 days?
questions.item16: If the average of four numbers is 15, and three of the numbers are 10, 20, and 25, what is the value of the fourth number?
questions.item17: A store sells a pair of shoes for $60, and during a sale, they offer a 15% discount. After the discount, they add a 5% sales tax. What is the final price of the shoes?
questions.item18: The median of 7 numbers is 12. If 6 of the numbers are 5, 8, 11, 14, 15, and 17, what is the value of the 7th number?
questions.item19: The probability of a particular event occurring is 0.3. If the event is repeated 5 times, what is the expected number of occurrences?
questions.item20: A company sells a product for $100. The company spends $40 to make each product and $20 in overhead costs. How many products must the company sell to break even?
questions.item21: In a population of 200 people, 60% are female. How many males are in the population?
questions.item22: A graph of the linear function y = 2x + 3 passes through the point (4, y). What is the value of y?
questions.item23: A store sells pencils for $0.50 each. If a customer buys 6 pencils and pays with a $5 bill, how much change does the customer receive?
questions.item24: If 3x + 4y = 20 and 2x - y = 5, what is the value of x + y?
questions.item25: A store sells 100 items per day at $30 each. If the store increases its price by 20%, how many items will need to be sold at the new price of $36 to maintain the same revenue?
questions.item26: A car travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour. How many hours will it take for the car to travel 180 miles?
questions.item27: If 25% of a number is 20, what is the number?
questions.item28: The average of three numbers is 24. If two of the numbers are 22 and 26, what is the third number?
questions.item29: A bag contains 5 red balls, 6 blue balls, and 9 green balls. If a ball is selected at random, what is the probability of selecting a green ball?
questions.item30: The average age of 5 people is 35. If the ages of 4 people are 28, 30, 40, and 38, what is the age of the fifth person?
questions.item31: A store sells a product for $50. The store applies a 15% markup on the cost price. What is the cost price of the product?
questions.item32: A class of 30 students has an average score of 80 on a test. If the total score of 29 students is 2300, what is the score of the 30th student?
questions.item33: If the total cost of 10 items is $500, what is the average price per item?
questions.item34: A company increased its sales by 10% each year for 3 years. If the sales in the first year were $100,000, what were the sales in the third year?
questions.item35: The average of 8 numbers is 45. If one of the numbers is 20, what is the sum of the other 7 numbers?
questions.item36: The price of an item is decreased by 10%. If the original price was $200, what is the new price?
questions.item37: A survey of 100 people shows that 40 people prefer reading books, 35 people prefer watching TV, and 25 people prefer both. How many people prefer neither?
questions.item38: A car travels 100 miles in 2 hours, then 150 miles in 3 hours. What is the average speed of the car for the entire trip?
questions.item39: A factory produces 150 units per day. If the factory operates for 30 days, what is the total production?
questions.item40: A student scored 85, 90, and 80 on three tests. What score must the student get on the fourth test to have an average score of 85?
